name: MessageBox.getMessageList
description: If run in detail mode returns entire message list for a user. If not run in detail mode then returns summary information of mailbox

inputs.notes: Yes or No are valid values. Used to send corporate broadcast messages
Which message number to start at
How many records to return at a time
Message ID when run in detail mode
How many days to include of messages
ID of message Box To Use

outputs.notes: If this is set to “Y” then it came from the corporate company.
This is the total number of messages in the inbox. This will be returned on every line
This is the date the message was sent
Email address of the person who sent the message (for informational purposes)
Y or N if the message can be forwarded or not.
Attachment length if it’s a recording
Attachment ID
This will tell if the message has an attachment. If the value is “F” it is a PDF file. If it is “C”, then it is a WebMeeting. If it is a “V”, then it is an mp3.
This is the unique ID number of the person that sent the message
Length of the voice message
Mailbox number
ID of external media number
This will be the unique message ID of each individual message in the list
This is what type of message it is. “T” for text and “V” for voice or audio (e.g. mp3)
Name of the person who sent the message
Date message was opened
If this is set to “N”, then the message cannot be replied to
This is the date the message was sent
“PASS” or “FAIL”
This is the summary of the message or the subject
Title message ID
This marks if it has been read or not. If the message is an “S” then it has been read. “N” is new.
This flags says if the message is urgent or not
This will be the URL to the attachment. Below is an example URL of each kind of attachment
This is the URL to the primary text or the voice of the message.  Here is an example of what the URL will look like. It will be earthier a text or mp3.
This is the image of the person that sent the message
